Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
Task : 'switch'
parameter can not be
dimensioned
Message.Actions:
Remove the array dimension
specification, or change the data type
of the parameter.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
Task : 'switch'
parameter must have
transfer mode IN (specified value
)
Message.Actions:
Remove the parameter transfer mode
specifier. If IN transfer mode is not
sufficient, change the data type of the
parameter.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : 'switch' only
allowed for optional parameter
(not for )
Message.Actions:
Change the parameter into an optional
parameter, or change the data type of
the parameter. If the object is not a
parameter, change the data type.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Value type class
for must be one of
REAL_SYMVALTYP_VAL, _SEMIVAL, _NONVAL or
_NONE (specified value )
Message.Actions: Change the value type class.

Message.Title: Data declaration error
Message.Description:
Task : Too many array
dimensions for
(specified value )
Message.Actions: An array may have at most 3 dimensions.

Message.Title: Name error
Message.Description:
Task : Symbol name
is not a RAPID identifier excluding
reserved words
Message.Actions:
The names of installed objects,
including parameters and components,
must be legal RAPID identifiers not
equal to any of the reserved words of
the RAPID language. Change the name.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Missing C
function for
Message.Actions:
A C-function that executes the ReaL
function being defined, must be
specified.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Missing value
initialization function for
Message.Actions:
A value initialization function must be
specified.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
is not a data type name (object
)
The specified name identifies an object
other than a type.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task :
is not a value data type (object
)
Only record components, alias types,
variables and 'VAR' mode parameters may
be of semi-value or non-value type.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Missing value
conversion function for
Message.Actions:
A value conversion function must be
specified for a semi-value type.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Not enough
memory for value of data
Message.Actions: More memory required.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Private type
can only be semi-value
or non-value type (specified value
)
Message.Actions: Change the value type class.

Message.Title: Type definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Private type
size must be multiple
of 4 (specified value )
Message.Actions:
All RAPID types must have a size that is
a multiple of four. Change the specified
type size.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description:
Task : Persistent type
mismatch for
Message.Actions:
There is already a persistent data with
the same name but with another data
type. Rename the persistent, or change
its data type.

Message.Title: Reference error
Message.Description:
Task : Unknown data type
name for
Message.Actions:
There is no data type (or other object)
with the specified name.

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description:
Task : Unknown parameter
transfer mode for
Message.Actions:
The specified parameter transfer mode is
not one of IN, 'VAR', 'PERS', 'INOUT' or
REF. Use corresponding REAL_SYMPARMOD_x.

Message.Title: Symbol definition error
Message.Description:
Task : Unknown symbol
definition type
The symbol definition type tag does not
specify one of the allowed symbol
types (REAL_SYMDEF_x).

Message.Title: Undo Aborted
Message.Description:
Task
The program execution was stopped while processing the UNDO statements.
UNDO was not fully executed.
The routine was executing when UNDO was stopped.
Message.Actions:
If the processing of UNDO takes too long, try to remove time-consuming
instructions such as TPWrite from the UNDO-clause.
If the undo processing never seems to finish, make sure any loops in the undo-statements are correct.

Message.Title: Undo Aborted
Message.Description:
Task
The processing of UNDO was aborted due to an EXIT-statement in the routine .
UNDO was not fully executed.

Message.Title: Undo Aborted
Message.Description:
Task
The processing of UNDO was aborted due to a run-time error in routine .
UNDO was not fully executed.
Message.Actions: Investigate the cause of the error.

Message.Title: Undo Aborted
Message.Description:
Task
The instructions BREAK, RAISE, RETURN and STOP are not allowed to use in an
undo-clause or any routine that is called from an undo-clause.
The instruction was found in UNDO context when
executing the routine .
Message.Actions: Avoid executing the instruction when in undo-context.

Message.Title: Undo Aborted
Message.Description:
Task
The program execution of UNDO statements was aborted due to edit operation.

Message.Title: File access error
Message.Description: Task is trying to access file , but failing.
Message.Consequences: No data in the file may be accessed.
Message.Actions: 1) Check if the file is write protected, and in such case change the setting.

Message.Title: File access error
Message.Description: Task is trying to access file , but does not find file or directory.
Message.Consequences: If the missing file is a module, no automatic loading to a task is possible.
Message.Causes:
-File may not have been correctly copied to the target directory.
-File or directory may have incorrect name.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure the file and directory names are correct.

Message.Title: File access error
Message.Description: Task is trying to access file , but failing.
Message.Consequences: No data in the file may be accessed.
Message.Causes: No storage space available on device.
Message.Actions: 1) Make sure there is enough storage space available.

Message.Title: File access error
Message.Description: Task is trying to access file , but failing.
Message.Consequences: No data in the file may be accessed.
Message.Causes:
-File may be write protected.
-File or directory may have incorrect name.
-No storage space available on device.
Message.Actions:
1) Check if the file is write protected, and in such case change the setting.
2) Make sure the file and directory names are correct.
3) Make sure there is enough storage space available.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Description:
Task : RAPID syntax
error(s) in file
Message.Actions:
The source file to be loaded contains
RAPID syntax errors. Correct the source
file.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Description:
Task : Syntax error(s)
in header in file
Message.Actions:
The source file to be loaded contains
syntax error in the file header. Correct
the source file. The syntax errors are
logged in a separate file.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Actions:
Cannot load RAPID source code in the
national language specified in the file
header.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Description:
Task :
A big enough free program memory block is not available. The ordered operation could not be completed.
Message.Causes: The program memory is full or fragmentated.
Message.Actions:
Check if large data structures could be split into smaller blocks.
Use of installed modules can save program memory.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Actions: The program is too complex to load.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Actions:
Cannot load RAPID source code of the
version specified in the file header.

Message.Title: Load error
Message.Description:
Task:
Program memory is full.
Message.Actions:
The module could not be loaded because the program memory is full.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Module installation failure
Message.Description: Task: It is not possible to install a module from file .
Message.Consequences: The module will not be installed.
Message.Causes: The RAPID module may have RAPID errors.
Message.Actions:
1) Check the event messages in the Elog domain RAPID
2) Correct the RAPID errors and make a P-start.

Message.Title: RAPID errors in installed module
Message.Description:
Task: . Module (line/column):
There is an error with symbol: .
Message.Consequences: The module will not be installed.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Operand types and for the '/', 'DIV' or 'MOD' operator not equal
Message.Actions: The two operands of the '/', 'DIV' or 'MOD' operators must have equal type. Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Type error
Message.Description: Operand types and for the '<', '<=', '>' or '>=' operator not equal
Message.Actions: The two operands of the '<', '<=', '>' or '>=' operators must have equal type. Check the operand types.

Message.Title: Memory allocation error
Message.Description:
Task : Failed to
allocate hash table, use linear list

Message.Title: Memory allocation error
Message.Description:
Task : Failed to
update persistent expression, keep old
one

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit Missing!
Message.Description: The mechanical unit component of the workobject is faulty.
Message.Causes:
- No mechanical unit is defined.
- The mechanical unit defined can not be found.
- The robot can not move the workobject by itself.
Message.Actions: Check the mechanical unit component of the workobject.

Message.Title: A copy of a dynamic loaded module has been saved.
Message.Description:
Task:
A dynamic loaded module has been changed.
The module is lost when PP is set to main.
A copy of the changed module is saved on
Message.Causes:
- A dynamic loaded module has been changed.
- PP is set to main.
- The dynamic loaded module is removed.
- A copy of the changed module is saved.
Message.Actions: If the changes shall be saved, replace the original file with the copy.

Message.Title: A Stop/QStop event routine has been stopped.
Message.Description:
Task:
A event routine has been stopped by an external stop command. Any running Stop/QStop event routines will be stopped after ms when controller receives second stop command.
Message.Actions: Keep all event routines short and free from RAPID instructions of type WaitTime, WaitDI, etc.

Message.Title: Missing Error Handler
Message.Description: There is no error handler that deals with the process error for task .
Message.Consequences: The program will not be able to execute past the next move instruction.
Message.Actions: Add an error handler. The error handler should include the StartMove (StartMoveRetry) instruction.

Message.Title: RMQ message discarded
Message.Description: A RMQ message was discarded in task . received a RMQ message that couldn't be handled.
Message.Consequences: The RMQ message was discarded without any notification to the sender.
Message.Causes:
There can be several different reasons.
1. No interrupt is connected to the type of the received message.
2. No interrupt could be created because the interrupt queue was full.
3. The received message was corrupt.
Message.Actions: Make sure that the task has connected an interrupt to all types of messages that is possible to receive. Read about IRMQMessage in the RAPID reference maunal.

Message.Title: Digital Input Break
Message.Description:
Task:
A digital input interrupted the execution.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Parameter error
Message.Description: Task:
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description: Task:
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Limit Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Can not step further back on path .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Orientation Value Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Wrong orientation value in .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: All used orientations must be normalized, i.e. the sum of the quaternion elements squares must equal 1.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The parameter in is specified with a negative value.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: The parameter must be set to a positive value.

Message.Title: Missing External Axis Value
Message.Description: Some active external axis have incorrect or no order value.
Message.Actions: Reprogram the position.

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Not possible to activate or deactivate mechanical unit. Previous message may contain more information.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Execution Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The robot is too far from path to perform StartMove of the interrupted movement.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Position the robot to the interrupted position in the program.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Type Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Illegal data type of argument for parameter .
Message.Actions: Change the parameter to a legal type. Make sure the value type is value or semivalue.

Message.Title: Type Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Expected type differs from read type in .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the type in the argument.

Message.Title: End Of File
Message.Description:
Task:
End of file was found before all bytes were read in .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Limit Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Stop watch overflow.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Mechanical Unit Conflict
Message.Description: Not possible to deactivate mechanical unit due to the configuration.
Message.Actions: Check the configuration.

Message.Title: Conveyor Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The conveyor is not activated.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Conveyor Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
No single number defined.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: Conveyor Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The mechanical unit is not a single.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unable to open .
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: - The I/O device reference is already in use.
Message.Actions:
- If the I/O device reference is already in use, close it or use another.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
File or serial channel is not open.
ProgramRef.
Message.Causes: - The I/O device reference is not open, or has already been closed
Message.Actions:
- Check that device is open
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not access the file .
Program Ref.
Message.Causes:
- The path or filename is wrong.
- The I/O device reference is already in use.
- The maximum number of simultaneously opened files is exceeded.
- The disk is full.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path or filename.
- If the I/O device reference is already in use, close it or use another.
- Check the disk space.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The number of characters, parameter in WriteBin, you want to write to the serial channel is greater than the size of the array containing the characters to be written.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Make the array bigger or decrease the parameter.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The array in WriteBin is smaller than 0 or greater than 255.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change the size of the array to be 0 - 255.

Message.Title: Timeout
Message.Description:
Task:
A timeout interrupted the execution.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: Type Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The data you was trying to read in the file was not a numeric type.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Too many pending read requests.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The serial channel is not open, or you are trying to use the instruction on a file.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Open the serial channel.
- Check that the instruction is used on a serial channel.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Max Time Expired
Message.Description:
Task:
The programmed waiting time has expired.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Recovery:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Not allowed option in this task.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
is not a directory.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check that the path is the correct path to the directory you want to open.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Directory is not accessible.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check the directory you are trying to open.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not access the file system .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path and filename.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
You cannot open .
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: There are too many directories already open.
Message.Actions:
Close one of the already open directories.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not create the directory .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path.
- Check write and execute permission for the directory under which the new directory should be created.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not remove the directory .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path.
- Check write and execute permission for the directory under which the directory you want to remove is located.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not remove the file .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path.
- Check if you have write permission for the file.
- Check write and execute permission for the directory under which the file you want to remove is located.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not rename the file .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path.
- Check write permission for the file you want to rename.
- Check write and execute permission for the directory under which the file you want to rename is located.
Recovery:

Message.Title: File Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Could not copy the file .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
- Check the path.
- Check write permision for the directory that you want to copy the file to.
- Check the available space.
Recovery:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown mechanical unit .
The data of type mecunit is unknown for the system.
Program Ref.
Message.Causes: Data of type mecunit has been declared in the program.
Message.Actions: Remove the declaration of mecunit data in the program and use one of the predefined data of type mecunit (automatic defined by the system).

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unable to read I/O signal.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unable to write I/O signal.
Program Ref.

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Configuration error for I/O signal.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the IO signal configuration or alias definition.

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unable to read the I/O signal in unit .
Program Ref.

Message.Title: I/O Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unable to write to the I/O signal in unit .
Program Ref.

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Can't save program module .
Program Ref.

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
is not a module name.
Program Ref.
Message.Consequences: You cannot unload, save or erase this module.
Message.Actions: Check the name of the module.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Unknown axis number for the mechanical unit .
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Check the value for argument AxisNo.
Recovery:

Message.Title: System Access Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Mechanical unit is not active.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Activate the mechanical unit.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Orientation definition error.
GripLoads attach frame in tool or work object (user + object) is unnormalized.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the orientation. All used orientations must be normalized i.e. the sum of the quaternion elements squares must equal 1.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Both arguments must be > 0.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the value of the arguments.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Both arguments must be > 0 and <= 100.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the value of the arguments.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Quaternion error.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Check the aom component of loaddata.

Message.Title: Parameter Error
Message.Description:
Task:
Axis may not have a value less than 0.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Change to a positive value.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument AccMax must be set if the argument AccLim is set to TRUE.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Set a value to argument AccMax.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The argument DecelMax must be set if argument DecelLim is set to TRUE.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions: Set a value to argument DecelMax.

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The value of parameter AccMax is too low.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Increase the value of parameter AccMax.
Recovery:

Message.Title: Argument Error
Message.Description:
Task:
The value of parameter DecelMax is too low.
Program Ref.
Message.Actions:
Increase the value of parameter DecelMax.
Recovery:
